00063             /*
00064                 This time value represents the time in seconds since the 
00065                 tracking was started, that is, since the start button was 
00066                 pushed. The time gets reset when the stop button is pushed
00067                 and the start button is pushed again. However, this will 
00068                 also create a new logfile, and therefore, this time
00069                 will always start with 0 in each logfile. 
00070 
00071                 @if SM_COREDATA_LANGUAGE_PYTHON
00072                 def experimentTime(self):
00073                     """Returns a floating point value which is the time since tracking started in seconds.
00074 
00075                     This time value represents the time in seconds since the 
00076                     tracking was started, that is, since the start button was 
00077                     pushed. 
00078                     
00079                     The time gets reset when the stop button is pushed
00080                     and the start button is pushed again. However, this will 
00081                     also create a new logfile, and therefore, this time
00082                     will always start with 0 in each logfile. 
00083                     """
00084                 @endif
00085             */
00086             double experimentTime() const;

00131             /*
00132                 This field contains a user defined id that can be triggered by 
00133                 events such as pressing function keys etc. The operator can use
00134                 these tags to mark the point in time when certain events occurred
00135                 during the experiment. No event is marked by value 0.
00136             */
